title: Add onsite Unity Network App download links and incorporate UnityNodes media-kit logos

requirements.text: Add a prominent, mobile-responsive "Get the Unity Network App" section that links to the official app store pages: Google Play https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.unitynodes.unityapp and Apple App Store https://apps.apple.com/us/app/unity-network-app/id6755482738. Place this section on the public site (at minimum on the Home/Landing page) and ensure the links open in a new tab with proper rel attributes.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays a clearly labeled section offering both Google Play and Apple App Store links.
Both links use the exact URLs provided and open in a new tab (target="_blank") with rel="noopener noreferrer".
Section layout is responsive on small screens (buttons/badges stack and remain readable/tappable).

requirements.text: Download and add UnityNodes media-kit logo assets from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html into the frontend as static public assets, prioritizing the available logos, and use them in the UI where appropriate (e.g., within the new download section and/or header/footer), without serving these images via the backend.

quotes: also some images from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html should be downloaded onto the site especially the available logos

acceptanceCriteria: Logos from https://unitynodes.io/media-kit.html are added to the repo under a public static assets directory (frontend/public/...).
The site renders at least one of the downloaded logo assets in a public-facing section (e.g., the download section).
No backend endpoints are added/used to serve these images.

requirements.text: Update user-facing text around the app-download links and any displayed media-kit logos to be in English and to clearly indicate these are external app store destinations (no implication that the Unity mobile app itself runs on ICP).
acceptanceCriteria: Download section includes English copy that makes it clear the user is going to external app store pages.
Copy does not state or imply the Unity mobile app is ICP-powered.
All added/updated user-facing text for this change is English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components).
Do not edit immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Serve downloaded media-kit images as static frontend assets (frontend/public/...) only; do not serve images via the Motoko backend.
nonGoals: Do not implement deep-linking into native apps or any install/referral tracking.
Do not add third-party analytics or external SDK integrations related to the app store links.
